title: Why everyone is ragequitting even in ranked now?
body:
Lately i found the amount of ragequits so much high! It's not just episodes.
A lot of people just quit the game after one freaking death in lane, and most of them are toplaners (well, i can understand their situation but it's not an excuse).
Inting and trolling has the same problem...it's like no one cares anymore.

The ragequit teammate it's still my most hated situation. Ever.

replies.body: Probably because losing is today is way more frustrating then in previous seasons. When you lose today you will get bursted down again and again and again without any chance to do something against it.

Exacly, Lets say u facing kled in toplane, He 1st blood u and have demolish So he shoved wave and got plat, Thats near 600 gold lead. Game is over at that point for toplaner specialy with how broken kled and his passive, He can 1v2 you with ur jgl for rest of game

> [{quoted}](name=Alx Neo Da,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=00050002,timestamp=2019-09-10T23:29:48.118+0000)
>
> Exacly, Lets say u facing kled in toplane, He 1st blood u and have demolish So he shoved wave and got plat, Thats near 600 gold lead. Game is over at that point for toplaner specialy with how broken kled and his passive, He can 1v2 you with ur jgl for rest of game

Seriously. The amount of effort and luck needed to take back a lead or break even relies way too much on how good or bad the enemy plays instead of your own planning and execution. They hold all the cards based off one single small victory when that simply should not be the case. 

You get fucking rich off turret plates now, and turrets themselves still do no damage and can't defend you from a dive. Diving should be WAY more dangerous than it is, but it's so easy to do now because towers weren't actually made better.

> [{quoted}](name=Kovorix,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-09-09T20:02:12.935+0000)
>
> Probably because losing is today is way more frustrating then in previous seasons. When you lose today you will get bursted down again and again and again without any chance to do something against it.

Maybe, the players have gotten older and don't handle stress as well as they used to.

Just saying...

(Or maybe it's a consequence of perceived repeated disappointments from this franchise...)
I would think the opposite is true. I don't think I handled stress as well when I was a child, I don't think I "handled" it at all.

> [{quoted}](name=NaturesMayhem,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2019-09-10T17:28:32.633+0000)
>
> I would think the opposite is true. I don't think I handled stress as well when I was a child, I don't think I "handled" it at all.

Not everybody is the same. But most people become less resilient, in certain ways, as they get older. This is tempered by enhanced experience and wisdom (hopefully).

Adults tend to have less patience. Adults have other responsibilities for their time. These could all contribute.
This is completely true. Im one of those types of people.

That's it for me, I've never quit because I rather not get punished for it. However, the urge is there instantly upon first death. Because at my skill level, that's just game over. That enemy is just going to harass me out of my minion wave and kill me anytime I try to farm now. There's no coming back and I rather not spend the next 10 mins in a lane farming under tower and being generally useless.

When defense is shit or damage is high toxicity is higher. 

Honestly a lot of times one death makes lane feel not winnable, so instead of wasting time they just leave. 

It’s a mentality issue that comes with high damage hopeless feeling metas.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-09-09T20:16:46.466+0000)
>
> When defense is shit or damage is high toxicity is higher. 
> 
> Honestly a lot of times one death makes lane feel not winnable, so instead of wasting time they just leave. 
> 
> It’s a mentality issue that comes with high damage hopeless feeling metas.

^ This.

Game is too snowbally and dying once in lane often leads to getting oneshot over and over again because burst damage is way too high right now.

It may not be as much a rage quit as you may think. The servers ever since clash came out have been very buggy, people have very high ping and it leaves people more inclined to leaving, hell, even ive left a few matches because of this, their internet could have also cut out, plenty of possible reasons. Some of them are rage quits, im sure, but not all of them.
Ehm no dude. I'm talking about when ppl like declare in the chat "bye bye" and then they don't return in the game at all. At first death.

> [{quoted}](name=Xphineas,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-09-09T14:22:50.016+0000)
>
> It may not be as much a rage quit as you may think. The servers ever since clash came out have been very buggy, people have very high ping and it leaves people more inclined to leaving, hell, even ive left a few matches because of this, their internet could have also cut out, plenty of possible reasons. Some of them are rage quits, im sure, but not all of them.

But also, many people who probably weren't ready to play Ranked, did enter Ranked in order to participate in Clash. Perhaps this is a side effect...

I don't know if it's productive or proper for Riot to induce people in that way to start Ranked, earlier than they might otherwise. (Yeah, there's reward for playing Ranked, but lately they've actually had missions, as though they were having a drive.)
I didn't know that in order to do clash you needed ranked...i just think level 30 is way too soon nowadays.

> [{quoted}](name=RebeccaUCuber,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-09-09T16:08:16.119+0000)
>
> I didn't know that in order to do clash you needed ranked...i just think level 30 is way too soon nowadays.

I think it was always. There are posts in the archives from... like... practically since there were boards...  advising how long to wait after reaching lvl 30 to try ranked. New players should probably wait even longer now, in general...
and then we see lv 30 facing golds in placements xD

Speaking as someone who so call "rage quits" a lot of ranked matches let me see if I can enlighten you. I've played since season 5 and I'm guessing quite a few still around today have been playing a lot longer. This "never surrender" approach to the game was far more relevant then. In season 5 and probably earlier, a score line of say, 5-22 didn't mean a sure loss. In fact, a high percentage of these games eventually became even, with quite a lot of comebacks. However, since season 8, 5-22 means game over and only a few of us have caught on to the change. This creates a situation where there are a lot of people who still refuse to surrender with the few of us who have realized that the game has changed. So, we rage quit so as not to waste time. If more people would realize sooner when a game is unwinnable, then we wouldn't need to leave games because of stubborn people.

> [{quoted}](name=FioraWillCarry,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-09-09T16:25:45.450+0000)
>
> Speaking as someone who so call "rage quits" a lot of ranked matches let me see if I can enlighten you. I've played since season 5 and I'm guessing quite a few still around today have been playing a lot longer. This "never surrender" approach to the game was far more relevant then. In season 5 and probably earlier, a score line of say, 5-22 didn't mean a sure loss. In fact, a high percentage of these games eventually became even, with quite a lot of comebacks. However, since season 8, 5-22 means game over and only a few of us have caught on to the change. This creates a situation where there are a lot of people who still refuse to surrender with the few of us who have realized that the game has changed. So, we rage quit so as not to waste time. If more people would realize sooner when a game is unwinnable, then we wouldn't need to leave games because of stubborn people.

While I condemn your method, you do bring up a good point, about how gameplay has changed in the past 21 months.

Lol 21 months. It’s only gotten shitier since they removed the heal and tank meta season 1.

Back then it really was never give up because you could still comeback at the 90 minute mark. Just had to hold out.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2019-09-09T20:18:54.756+0000)
>
> Lol 21 months. It’s only gotten shitier since they removed the heal and tank meta season 1.
> 
> Back then it really was never give up because you could still comeback at the 90 minute mark. Just had to hold out.

Well i'm happy it changed then, because i'm definitely not fond of 90 minuts games.
They were pretty rare, just fun to mention, because sometimes load was like 10min too.

Ye basically. Was playin with one of those never surrender types, who would get mad at me that id call games at 10-15 mins. But i was never wrong, unless the opponent just has a troll comp theres almost no way to come back from a bad early. Having any gold advantage in the current meta gives u the ability to make more gold way to easily, and with burst meta and such low skill champs being overtuned, its super hard for opponents to throw.

Don't you love how they then blame it on you? "Well you tilted early so you weren't trying".... 

the delusional state people live in is both frightening, repulsive, and saddening.

Because there's no point to trying, and Riot doesn't punish you.

inb4 "REEE IF THEY BAN FOR 1 AFK THEN WHAT ABOUT ACTUAL EMERGENCIES REEEEEE"

Riot needs about 7 afks for a punishment. You know what I do when I have an emergency or connection issues? I stop playing until I know it's all fixed. Most afks I had in a week was 3. 1 for internet, 1 for when the power went out, and 1 when I heard a loud crash in my kitchen. The fact I wasn't punished was fucking baffling.
The game pisses people off because it's more frustrating than it needs to be.
We need defense back in the game.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2019-09-10T06:21:30.359+0000)
>
> We need defense back in the game.

Yes, we do.
defensive playstyle or defensive stats? We didn't ever lose defensive stats, damage just went up along with runes.

Buddy, tanks at a four item build have lost:

1,500HP
80 Armor
60 MR
Untold health regen as what was once a core tank stat to rival lifesteal has now been all but gutted except in the singular case of a Warmogs with 2-3 other HP items.  But guess what?  None of that is *IN COMBAT* so it doesn't make you last longer in a fight at all. 
7% MS

Give all that shit back, and suddenly you'd see people actually playing tanks again.

Too many times ppl want to ff when their lane went slighty bad even if the rest of the team is super fed...that's the problem.
I understand super mega lost games, but not the situation i mentioned.

> [{quoted}](name=Krispy Cack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-09-09T16:11:30.823+0000)
>
> because my team doesn't refuse to surrender so I afk

My adc is 7/2 but I lost 2 deaths to my lane. I can't carry so we ff. No ff I'll afk.
This mentality won't let you climb lol

> [{quoted}](name=ﬂoo,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2019-09-10T12:18:52.457+0000)
>
> This mentality won't let you climb lol

Actually, that's bullshit.

https://lan.op.gg/summoner/userName=xelniya

I "rage quit" a lot of games when I played on this account but I still had an overall 53% win rate which means I was still winning more than I was losing. Playing unwinnable games is just a waste of time.

> [{quoted}](name=FioraWillCarry,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2019-09-10T16:09:56.083+0000)
>
> Actually, that's bullshit.
> 
> https://lan.op.gg/summoner/userName=xelniya
> 
> I "rage quit" a lot of games when I played on this account but I still had an overall 53% win rate which means I was still winning more than I was losing. Playing unwinnable games is just a waste of time.

And where did you start? You spent 250 games to get gold. You could've probably had more wins if you didn't leave too early.

This mentality is bullshit. If you lose your lane, stop crying and being a weight to people who could carry you. This "I can predict a win or a loss from champ select" mindset is why you're down there and not even further up. + it ruins the possibility to win for 4 other people everytime you do it.
Season 9 is breaking people mentally.

With how toxic and shitty the gameplay is right now who can you blame. I'm honest and tell you i've ragequitted more games this season than the last 9 years of league combined. When i'm talking about the game everything is toxic. Getting permanently banned, chatrestricted and shit for saying simple stuff made me realize it's not worth it. Even without any insults everything seems to be "toxic" nowadays.

So if i'm playing for example a lanebully toplane get camped to hell while botlane is losing despite playing 4v2 with my team i take the shortway out and save me the time, nerves and frustration. Why even bother. Haven't even gotten a leaverbuster after ragequitting three games in a row. Riot just doesn't give a fuck at all.

People rage quit because comebacks are next to impossible with the current state of league. 

Being at a permanent disadvantage due to being down like 2 infernal drakes just ruins the game.
because playing from behind is worse than ever before. whats the point of playing if you cant even get into xp range.
Toxicity at what seems a all time high. Congrats.
because it doesn't get you punished like saying bad words does, yeah that's pretty much it.

Because all you need is 1 death to start the snowball. A 400 gold lead in bot lane spells the end of ever being able to engage the enemy laner, even in mid as well as an extra longsword or spellbook assures you win every single trade, making you reliant on your jungler to bring you back online or watch yourself being starved off CS unless you want to lose half your health or die altogether to an all-in.

Weak mental.

People buy into the "gg 2-0 at 8 minutes FF". They start caring less, feeding further, etc. "Never say die" mentality is gone because people find any game that's not a basic absolute stomp or a 1-1 slugfest completely unwinnable. Games can still be brought back but frankly you can't bring anything back when your mid laner mentally afks because Irelia is 2-0 with 50 CS at 13 minutes.

Worst argument I've ever heard. 

I know when a game is over, but I still try my hardest as if it isn't. I 99% of the time not wrong though. The game is a loss. 

Just because someone is intelligent enough to understand the fundamentals of the game and how it works, and knowing when a game is essentially a loss, does not make someone who is not caring, or somehow throwing the game due to "not caring". 

Nor is someone who is blind to these facts, and has a "never give up" attitude going to miraculous pull wins where the other wouldn't. Nor does it make them smarter, or more clear sighted... 

"Mentally afking" is a hyperbole fake argument based on nothing. You don't magically pull a win just because you're blind to how league plays out.

> [{quoted}](name=KnightLakega,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000e0003,timestamp=2019-09-10T22:58:45.490+0000)
>
> Worst argument I've ever heard. 
> 
> I know when a game is over, but I still try my hardest as if it isn't. I 99% of the time not wrong though. The game is a loss. 
> 
> Just because someone is intelligent enough to understand the fundamentals of the game and how it works, and knowing when a game is essentially a loss, does not make someone who is not caring, or somehow throwing the game due to "not caring". 
> 
> Nor is someone who is blind to these facts, and has a "never give up" attitude going to miraculous pull wins where the other wouldn't. Nor does it make them smarter, or more clear sighted... 
> 
> "Mentally afking" is a hyperbole fake argument based on nothing. You don't magically pull a win just because you're blind to how league plays out.

FUCKING. THIS.

A 2-0 lead is huge. You're not coming back from that unless the enemy massively throws. And in some match-ups, a 2-0 lead means they can kill you at will whenever they desire and you cannot farm. 

An example of this kind of match-up is Tryndamere vs Kayle. If Tryndamere gets even a 1 kill lead, he can just dive Kayle repeatedly at will. Nothing she could do and the jungler can't be around 24-7 to help her. 

Riven vs any squishy is another example of a match-up that is impossible to win if the Riven gets a 2 kill lead. Riven's opponent won't be able to farm at all and depending on who her opponent is, she will be able to dive and kill them over and over with impunity. 

Renekton vs any squishy is exactly the same as Riven vs a squishy. A 2-0 lead means they don't farm without dying and again, depending on the champion, they can get dove repeatedly with impunity.

Irelia and Darius, same as Riven and Renekton.

And that's just top lane. Bot lane has even more of these kinds of match-ups where a 2 kill lead means the lane will snowball massively in a very short space of time with 0 chance of the losing side being able to stop the bleeding much less make some kind of come back.

> [{quoted}](name=FioraWillCarry,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000e0001,timestamp=2019-09-10T16:22:49.694+0000)
>
> A 2-0 lead is huge. You're not coming back from that unless the enemy massively throws. 

(Or Jungler intervention.)
If you are 2-0 as a top laner before 10 minutes you most likely can 1v2 so jungler intervention just means that you lose faster

> [{quoted}](name=FioraWillCarry,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=43YhAuQV,comment-id=000e0001,timestamp=2019-09-10T16:22:49.694+0000)
>
> A 2-0 lead is huge. You're not coming back from that unless the enemy massively throws. And in some match-ups, a 2-0 lead means they can kill you at will whenever they desire and you cannot farm. 
> 
> An example of this kind of match-up is Tryndamere vs Kayle. If Tryndamere gets even a 1 kill lead, he can just dive Kayle repeatedly at will. Nothing she could do and the jungler can't be around 24-7 to help her. 
> 
> Riven vs any squishy is another example of a match-up that is impossible to win if the Riven gets a 2 kill lead. Riven's opponent won't be able to farm at all and depending on who her opponent is, she will be able to dive and kill them over and over with impunity. 

Doesn't have to be a squishy. If Riven gets 2 kills up on Garen, then she won the lane unless the Jungler steps in.

However, a lost lane, does not equal a lost game. There's two other lanes.

I'd argue you can't really build back into the game against something like the Irelia that is 2-0 with 50cs. 

stun dash r dash dash dash auto dash auto auto dead. <--- .5s too.
But you can, you play safe and just farm. It really isn't that hard. The community is simply plagued by a thick fog of the defeatist attitude.
